Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: CMN96
Reviews.Content: fine hotel with a location very close the city yet not too noisy. the breakfast is not a buffet, you dont get a choice so you better like croissants and white bread with jam. the rooms are okay, not too big and bathrooms are tiny with no locks on. theres TV and internet, all though the internet is free, every 24 hours you have to go get a slip at the desk with a new login.. and only one computer at a time per login. ask the person for another one i you need It. theres also only 1 plug in the whole room apart from the fridge/tv plugs so be prepared! overall experiance was good and i recommend this

Reviews.Title: “helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: jhuprincess
Reviews.Content: i was unaware of this but there is no air conditioning. which means that in order to get some circulation in the room, you have to open the windows. which isn't too bad but the street outside is rather noisy so its hard to get some rest. but the hotel is located very close to st. marks square. and the staff was always very polite and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location!”
Reviews.Author: YvesStGullbekk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in July of 2011. Though situated just 3-5 mins walk to St. MArk's Square, we had difficulty finding the hotel. Maybe because we arrived in Venice around noon time and the square was already swarmed with people! It was insane! The hotel itself is average but location is great. Breakfast is continental and plain. Nothing fancy here. Wireless internet is free which is a big plus for me! Definitely recommendable!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, Convenient and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: Allyouneed
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in mid-October - a perfect location in the heart of Venice. Thank you to other Trip Advisor reviewers we were able to find the hotel with no problem. The staff was warm and welcoming. The room itself was small, but, hey, it's Venice! The price included breakfast. It was very reasonably priced compared to other Venice Hotels. This is not an American Hotel, so do not expect a large room with all the comforts of home. It is typical European - small and clean, but old, and has not been updated in YEARS. It is however, clean and well maintained. The only downside is that the bed was hard as a rock, which we found in many Italian Hotels. The staff was delightful - helpful, and again, very welcoming. This location cannot be beat. The location absolutely cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: morrisdaug
Reviews.Content: We took the water bus from the airport to San Marco. The hotel was just beyond the Piazza and shopkeepers were very helpful in helping us locate the street and the hotel. We took the Aliguna water bus to the Cruise ship dock and were let off right at our ship. We redeemed Choice points for our stay and it was off season so very reasonable. The staff was very helpful. Breakfast very adequate. The best part was it's great location. We could go in to rest and then right back out to walk the charming streets. And pick up pizza and sandwiches and pastries to eat on the streets. Loved Venice and would definitely stay at the Hotel Diana again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: mizzou37
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location but difficult to find unless you follow directions very carefully. The rooms are small but perfectly adequate. The breakfast, while doesn't include eggs, fruit, meat/cheese etc. is good. It's FREE and includes croissants, yoghurt, etc. The breakfast doesn't start until 7:30 a.m. but they do have coffee etc., at the front desk. Important for early risers! My only complaint about this hotel is that the pillows are SO hard, it's like sleeping on a rock! How to get there: Take the vaporetto to the San Marco square stop. DO NOT TAKE A TAXI BOAT. They wanted 60 euro, whereas the vaporetto was 6.50 euro each. When you get off, walk to the right until you get to the main entrance/exit on the left. You will see a clock tower which uses roman numerals. Go through the archway of the tower, make your first right and take the second left. You will see a Best Western sign hanging on the right. The hotel does not have a sign hanging so you can't see it, but it's right before the Best Western, also on the right. Total travel from the archway to hotel is only about 150-200 yards.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT MORE COULD ONE WANT?”
Reviews.Author: John H
Reviews.Content: Well having read some of the previous reviews it just makes me wonder what people expect from a budget hotel ???? We traveled here a while ago , mysel my wife and our daughter who at the time was only 4 Months old , we stayed in march, with snow on the ground a baby plus luggage we must have been mad !! . WE LOVED IT , what an adventure ,even if it was freezing cold , yes getting from the airport was a bit of a faff , but this is venice, so it's to be expected - and it all adds to the experience. The water taxi dropped us at Piazza San Marco and the directions we were given from our travel agent took straight to the door of the hotel , (a good 5 minute walk ) I could'nt believe how central this little hotel was. We had a small room at the front of the hotel , the addition of our own travel cot made this even cosier , but hey we had bagged three nights in venice for around Â£400 including air fairs , so you are prepared to be a little forgiving. The staff were always friendly ,and able to offer advice when asked for. The lack of an evening meal option was a bit of a let down , but we managed, and found some great inexpensive resturants around the Piazza , The breakfasts were your typical continental affair, so plenty to eat even if it wasn't Bacon & eggs !!. The rooms are small , but again don't forget this is Venice so land & property are naturally at a premium.. But that said ours was comfortable with an en suite and Mini bar. We loved it here , and the experience gave me a lasting love affair for Venice that I will never forget.. I have rated the room as average - but that said It should be better than average - only slight detraction was it's size - but as I have previously said that is more than forgivable.. We would definatly return both to Venice and The Dianna Hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon from hell!”
Reviews.Author: Emma K
Reviews.Content: Not the hotels fault - more our travel agent however - So imagine my upset when we arrive to find it is a Comfort Inn. Not only was it the smallest bedroom ever but the shower was fixed to the wall at 4 foot. The bath was a half bath, the door smashed the bidet to get in and out the bathroom and the toilet was situated in such a way that if you sat correctly your chin and face hit the sink. The breakfast, for Italy, was sub standard and cleanliness left a lot to be desired ( mould in the bathroom) Great hotel for a quick sightseeing tour but not great for a honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Really good value for Venice the city of deep pockets”
Reviews.Author: Mandarine22
Reviews.Content: This hotel was true to previous recommendations. Very central, bathroom was generous, beds comfortable and very friendly helpful service at a reasonable cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lousy sleep, lousy breakfast”
Reviews.Author: tradIndy
Reviews.Content: Itâ€™s a great location a few hundred feet from San Marco and a 10 minute walk (5 if you donâ€™t dawdle) to the Rialto Bridge. We asked for a back room and the room was lovely only it looked out over an open air restaurant. Which we could hear with the window closed even though it was off season and there were only a few tables. The worst thing was the thin walls and floors. Around 2am we were woken by guests jumping around in the room above us. It takes a lot of noise to wake me up with earplugs and a full dose of ambien. But we did not get a decent sleep here for the noise the 3 nights we stayed. The breakfast was awful with a small basket of pre-packaged inedible and forgettable stuff. The room was fair sized. The bothroom was modern if a bit warn. The shower head is only about 5 feet high so you don't have to be very tall to have to duck under it. We didnâ€™t even bother with breakfast after that, it was that bad. The staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location... but that's about it!”
Reviews.Author: tke_303
Reviews.Content: Ok, so hereâ€™s the quick and dirty on not just this hotel, but Venice as a whole. First, getting here: When arriving at the airport and after getting through customs, signs will direct you to baggage claim and to the â€œtransportation areaâ€�. No big deal here, just follow the signs. However, getting to the island itself is a different storyâ€¦ First, you do have several options. In hind sight, I would MOST DEFINATLY recommend getting a water â€œtaxiâ€�, not the water â€œbusâ€�. There is a third option of taking an actual motorized vehicle bus, but it only travels to Venice (via a causeway bridge) and has one drop off point. If you take the actual vehicle bus to the one drop off point, youâ€™d be walking for probably 30min to 1.5 hours to any given point on the main island. If youâ€™re on any of the other islands (i.e. Murano or Lido), then your only option is really a water taxi or water bus anyways â€“ so keep reading. I strongly recommend the â€œwater taxiâ€� because itâ€™s fast, and will take you right to your hotel (if your hotel is on a canal) or a major drop off point close enough to it. We took a water bus b/c it was significantly cheaper at 25 euro per person round trip vs 100 euro for the water taxi one way. However, hereâ€™s the kicker â€“ the water bus operates like an actual vehicular bus, meaning it makes several (if not a dozen or so) stops along the way to San Marco Square (which is where this hotel is located). It took us literally 1 hour and 50 minutes to get from the airport to San Marco Square!!! Thatâ€™s right, and Iâ€™ll say it again â€“ 1hr50min boat ride! No joke, not kidding, and not very much fun. So, again â€“ the water taxi is 100 euro for the boat, not per-person. If youâ€™ve got 4 people (or more) in your group, spring for the extra price tag and take the water taxi. I think you can have up to 8 people in a water taxi, and still â€“ only 100 euro (the more people in your group, the more cost effective). There are several kiosks/stands in the transportation area on the 1st floor of the airport, so make your way there to purchase tickets on whatever mode of travel you select. FYI: The water bus ticketing company we bought our passes from charged our credit card transaction as a â€œcash advanceâ€�. Didnâ€™t find this out until we got home, and credit card company said there was nothing they could do about it. Anyways, whatever you select to get here, youâ€™ll need to disembark the water bus/taxi at San Marco Square to get to the Hotel Comfort Diana. Donâ€™t worry, because there are two stops for San Marco Square, if you miss the first one or are unsure donâ€™t freak out, just relax and get off at the second and make your way to the main square. Once in the square, make your way to the Bar American, you shouldnâ€™t miss it. Travel north past the Bar American through the tunnel, and then take your first right. Once you take the right, youâ€™d be traveling due East â€“ then take your 2nd left. Go about 75 yards North (you should now be on Calle dei Specchieri). Hotel will be on your right side, and do â€œLook Upâ€� as someone else said below, b/c you can and probably will pass it the first time or two. If you get lost, or canâ€™t find the street, just ask â€“ most locals are friendly enough to help if they can. Second, the hotel: So Iâ€™ve got mixed feelings about this property. Basically, this is an older hotel which probably hasnâ€™t been updated in years, if not multiple decades. You can sense the â€œhistoryâ€� of this place with its obvious age! The beds are hard as a table, and the pillows lack any â€œfluffâ€�. Comforter smelled musty too. In essence, not very good nights sleep. On the flip side the sheets and linens were clean â€“ so, thatâ€™s a plus I guess. Also, dÃ©cor and furnishings (and the room as a whole) were obviously not up-to-date, and I doubt theyâ€™ll be renovated any time soon. Furthermore, the price was astronomical for the quality you get. I think I paid about $458/usd per night. However, I pretty much knew all this going into this place. Iâ€™d read on Tripadvisor prior to making my reservation, so I was well informed on what to expect. With that said, I just didnâ€™t think I comprehended how much â€œold world charmâ€� this place would have, and believe me, itâ€™s got a lot of it. The staff seemed really indifferent to our needs or requests. Upon arriving, the front dest clerk give off an attitude like: â€œOh great, here are some more Americansâ€�, very un-welcoming feeling. Then, once we got settled into the room later that evening, there were no towels. After a call down to the front desk, and 30min later we got 2 (two) towels for 4 people in our room. Again, staff service not that great. It did get better the next couple of days/nights. We got the towel issue straight the next morning, and the â€œcontinentalâ€� breakfast was great. They lady who serves you was very nice & warm to us and our daughter, so kudos to her. We stayed in an adjoined two bedroom â€œsuiteâ€�, which was well suited for our 4 person troop! The rooms themselves, while from the times of antiquities, were very clean. TV was small, and only in the 1st bedroom, but then again â€“ youâ€™re not in Venice to watch TV, so this didnâ€™t bother us at all. With all that said â€“ this placeâ€™s saving grace, itâ€™s top feature by far â€“ is itâ€™s location, location, location!!!!! This hotel is literally a block from San Marco Square. From there, you are walking distance from anywhere on the main island of Venice. Canâ€™t begin to say enough about how this hotel is right on top of the action! Multiple restaurants (all very good) on the same street as the hotel, and around San Marco Square. If you want to be in the thick of it all, then this IS the hotel to be at! 3rd, when traveling around Venice: There is also a couple of the water bus/taxi stops in front of or near San Marco Square. I recommend buying a day pass for the water busses (10 euro/day), and you get unlimited use, takes you to pre-designated stops along the Grand Canal and multiple surrounding islands. You CAN walk to pretty much anywhere, but after the first couple of days, the water buses will be your friend! 4th, when eating at restaurants: Be aware, that most places charge a â€œcover chargeâ€� like youâ€™re going to a night club, AND that gratuity is almost always included (typically around 12.5%). This really irked me, b/c most waiters were just going through the motions, and not really waiting on you. Service at most restaurants was limited to getting your drink order (not coming back for refills), and dropping food off at your table with the check. With that said, the food was fantastic at everyplace we ate at â€“ so at least they got that right! OK, so thatâ€™s my 2 cents and opinion on the Comfort Hotel Diana & the City of Venice. Hope this helps someone make a decision. Pics included of the hotel for visual reference. I think this place fairly deserves 3 out of 5 rating. Room quality really about a â€œ2.5â€�, but the location is a â€œ5â€�. Again, to sum it up, older out-dated hotel which is clean & maintained well, but in an awesome location! Would recommend, and would stay here again. If you have any questions, you can contact me TripAdvisor, and Iâ€™d be happy to try and answer.

Reviews.Title: “It IS Venice...”
Reviews.Author: Oakvillermt
Reviews.Content: If you are walking here, luggage in tow, my advice is to LOOK UP. The sign is obscure. Walked past it twice. It is Venice! Small room - (expected though, it is Venice), clean, friendly staff. Breakfast was typically great, internet access. Elevator a bit slow, but if stairs are not a problem and time not crucial...who cares! Location, location location! Expensive for budget travellers maybe but again, it IS Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Never again. Great location doesn't account for poor quality or service”
Reviews.Author: TaJye
Reviews.Content: I planned a week long vacation between Rome, Florence, & Venice for my 31st birthday. I read all reviews and expected small, old rooms. I didn't expect bugs and poor customer service. When we checked in we were given maps. No one bothered to explain the map or offer any assistance. The map was confusion and color coded yet there was no legend, Needless to say we got lost alot. There were 9 of us and we were all on different floors. 2 of us were on the very top floor which meant we had to take the elevator and then carry our bags up a narrow, circular staircase. We were forced to carry our luggage because evidently the porter only works when he feels like it. Once we got up to our room we were okay until we entered the bathroom and saw ants, and other weird bugs (centipede look alikes) coming from the sink. We told the front desk and she basically told us were lying. She said no other guest has other complained about this and she lived down the street and has never had an issue with bugs. I'm still trying to figure out what her living down the street has to do with my room in the hotel having bugs but I digress, She then proceeded to give me directions to the market so I could buy bug spray. Of course I was two minutes from cursing her out but I asked her to go look in the rooms and see for herself. She couldn't do it right away and we had reservations so we left. When we returned she said she looked in the rooms and didn't see anything. Big surprise. The shower sprays some sort of debris out when the water is on (dirt, hair, etc) so taking a shower was out of the question. And if that wasn't bad enough when we tried to turn down the covers we found several hairs in the sheets. YUCK! I will never stay here again. The location and price was nice but it's not worth the sleepless, shower-less nights.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: bizbear
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reviewing a list of possible hotels from Air France Vacations on Trip Advisor. We had a really nice stay (Mar 12 - Mar 19 2011). We had a little trouble finding the street it was on as some construction on Piazza San Marco was covering up the signs that might have shown us the street name. (And you have to get used to street meaning something in the US we might consider an alley, often easy to miss), but after a few turns, we found the street and got to the hotel. The staff were always pleasant and helpful. Check in was very easy. Our room had a double bed and its own bathroom. The bathroom was large with a tub, bidet and a heated towel rack.. The bedroom was small and the only place to put clothes was a large armoire. Good for hanging things but no real room for small folded items like socks and underwear. There was working safe in the armoire that we used. 2 night stands by the bed, small but each had a deep drawer. The lighting in the bedroom was adequate - a large ceiling fixture that has only part of its lamps working plus 2 wall sconces that were to be used as bed side lights. The sconces did not provide enought light to read by if the main room light was turned off. There was a flat screen TV off to the side on top of a desk. It was somewhat hard to watch from bed as you had to turn you neck a lot & liable to get a stiff neck from the position. 2 English channels BBC news and CNBC news. Breakfast was inlcuded with our room, served 7:30 - 10:00 I believe. The breakfast room was at the back of the lobby. There appeared to be a nice patio but it was closed since the weather was too cool yet. Breakfast was brought out to you, a basket of breads (2 warm fruit filled croissant, 3 plain rolls, packed dry toasts/crackers) a basket of 2 yoghurts with assorted jams, honey and butter. Some type of a juice was served, never sure what kind it was, rather weak and you had your choice of tea, coffees, or chocolate to drink. No meats, eggs or cereals. The staff did check with us during our meal to see if we wanted any more to drink or any more bread, etc which was nice. But what was brought was sufficient. If you did not like the choice of yogurt brought out, they were quite happy to change it for you to some other flavor of your choice. The location right behind St Mark's is excellent. Many restaurants nearby but they looked more touristy than we wanted so we eat in other areas of the city. Our room (302) was at the back of the hotel and looked out over a small back street. The street was quiet. We occasionally heard other people in their rooms or in the halls but not much. They have a laptop that their clients can use, once the breakfast room is empty. You get a login from the desk and you can use the laptop for up to an hour at a time. You cannot print from the laptop. To do that, you need to email the documents to the hotel email address and they will print it for you. For our boarding passes, which downloaded as .pdf files, it was easier for me to go to an internet cafe and get everything directly & print directly. But others may find that they can work out the printing of things. The room had a minifridge stocked with water, sodas and prosecco. The charges were extremely reasonable (1euro for water, 2 euro for soda) so we sometimes used them as it was convenient & not too expensive. We enjoyed our stay in Venice and the hotel, location and staff helped a lot in our good time there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Lousy Bed”
Reviews.Author: omegaman1
Reviews.Content: The Comfort Diana is very well-located, and we enjoyed being so close to Piazza San Marco. The staff was wonderful, the room was clean, and the bathroom was newly renovated. The room was on the small side, but the bed was terrible. It was a fairly thin mattress on a wire frame. I suffered a backache for 3 days after checking out. Price was high for accomodations, but I suspect location was the major factor here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Sheilamarie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Nov 15-18, 2010 w/my adult daughter-2 females travelling alone. Hotel is very clean, safe, comfortable, and affordable! I got my rate discounted a little by being a member of Sam's Club-not much, but helps when you're comparing Euros to dollars! Beds were clean and comfortable and all rooms had free wireless-which we didn't have phones or computers, but brought our hand held wireless devices (an itouch and droid). The location could not have been better! Every morning we were awakened by the bells of San Marco-which we enjoyed that experience! Only gripes, which we could live with.....breakfast is very very minimal, almost not worth spending the time on. Basically consists of a croisant, or raisin bread or something, coffee, juice, or tea. Also, the shower heads are about 4 feet tall-not sure why they're built that way, but they are. Showers have good pressure and plenty of hot water and towels, they're just short (?). Food and shopping are steps from the room, so breakfast wasn't really a problem-we ate the breakfast and just ate lunch whenever we got hungry while we were out sightseeing. Another strange requirement is you need to turn in your room key every time you leave the hotel-not sure what that's all about, but we did and no one at the desk griped about getting our room key for us multiple times during the day. Oh one more gripe-temperature wasn't easy to regulate, but they have these wonderful large windows that open out to the street and we just opened the windows if the room got stuffy. Great little hotel-there's a best western directly across the street-looked very similar to this one if you're researching other options.

Reviews.Title: “excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: brbr47
Reviews.Content: Two blocks from Piazza San Marco Square. Take the vaporetto from the Santa Lucia train station towards San Marco Square. When you are in the square, next to the cathedral is the clock tower. Pass under the clock tower (on the corner is american Bakery or something similar. Take first right and second left (very small, typical venetian alley) The hoel is on the right, just before the great wwestern hotel. Rooms and breakfast was just fine. Alexandra, young lady at the desk, gave us great ideas as what to do in Venice. On Sunday we got up early and attended mass at the Cathedral - tourists are not allowed during mass. It was wonderful to attend mass at the Cathedral. We bought a 12 hour vaporetto ticket and enjoyed going place to place by the boat. We went to the Jewish Getto area - not too many tourists. Ate dinner in this area which was wonderful. Alexandra also suggested a restaurant close to the hotel and it was fabulous.Enjoy wonderful Venice - Don't take too much luggage - it becomes a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a very reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Cumbrianman
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is just off St.Mark's Square right in where everything happens in Venice. We stayed for four nights as a surprise (to me!) birthday present. Everything was great. We had one of the front double bedrooms on the 2nd floor which looked over the alley way to the hotel and to the Rialto bridge the otherway. We found the room reasonable in size, comfortable with air-con that worked (unlike some more costly hotels we've stayed in). The bathroom is small but it has all you need (don't forgat this hotel is classed as only 2 star!). The window is fully double glazed and has wooden shutters as well so any noise from outside is shut out. The lift is small but the wife, me and 2 large cases got in ok. The breakfast is basic but ok and the same each morning but the coffee is nice and plentyful. The main attraction about this hotel is it's location, just yards from the famous Saint Mark's Square and a short walk from the main water front with all the water buses. Plenty of places to eat nearby too. We loved this little hotel, the room and it's great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: thediver1964
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Diana for three nights in June 2010. The location is superb being about a 50 second walk from San Marco Square but benefits from being tucked away in what can only be described as being a side alley!! The hotel staff were all as friendly as can be and the facilities were spotlessly clean. The room we had was small but it is a budget hotel, so if you expect a large room pay for a larger hotel!! If anyone moans about room size then its bad planning by the guest... the hotel is what it is, nothing more!! I noticed that some numpty has critised the breakfast... its a small continental offering but enough to get you started! I assume the gripe came from someone who pays for a minimum buts expects a feast??? Venice is full of food.... go out and find some!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! All in all a hotel that I would recommend without a second thought and hopefully we will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location before cruise”
Reviews.Author: Shencrna
Reviews.Content: Get off the train, get a pass on the vaporeto, get off at St. Mark's, walk across and square, up one block, and you've arrived at a very clean, nice hotel. Good price, easy to walk anywhere. Next day, take the special vaporetto directly to the cruise terminal, avoiding bridges, buses trams, and walking.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: sean-tKerryIreland
Reviews.Content: Ok , so the name of the hotel may not do it a huge amount of favours and for the centre of Venice you might feel safer paying more but this hotel nestled only a stones throw form St Mark's square is excellent value. Room have a certain Venetian charm,reception is friendly and location is superb. Price comes with continental breakfast(give the cholestrol a skip for one morning!) . Would stay here again and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Last minute booking for 3 nights”
Reviews.Author: Karenjudd
Reviews.Content: Two room unit with double bed in each room, which was great for a family of 4. You usually cannot find accommodation in Europe for families. Price was right at 200/night. That is very good in Venice. My very favorite place in all the places I have visited in Europe and Canada. I have been back 3 times. Great location for hotel...Can walk to everything, and can take boat for low cost everywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised at bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: rainbowtravel
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice - once about five years ago with mother and sister, and when I took my husband to Venice two years ago I booked there again because of the wonderful location - just steps of St Marks square. Yes the rooms are small, breakfast sparse, clerks not overly friendly. Rooms old, but clean. Bathtub fine. Rooms small, but this describes economy rooms all over Europe. I was just reading reviews before booking my sister and her friends there for a stay and was shocked at all the bad ones. I thought the place had really gone down, but then I saw most of the posts are older than my last stay, so had to give the other side of the coin.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, friendly hotel-with elevator and breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Annzhanz
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night before a cruise. Arrived at the hotel after a overnight flight from Philadelphia. Caught the Venzia bus from the Airport to the Piazzole Roma-5 Euros for 2. Then we caught the red line to Rialto (another 5 euros) and it was about a 10 minute walk. Depending on time of day this may be a better choice than San Marco due to tidal flooding. I have talked to other travelors who spent up to 125 Euros for same trip in water taxi. So pack light and with wheels and enjoy a great dinner instead! The front desk kept our luggage since our room was not ready. They had a restroom we freshened up in. The location is perfect. If you get lost ,follow the signs back to San Marco and your hotel is a minute away! On our return, our luggage had been placed in our room. Our room was small with 2 twins pushed together. We had a window which overlooked a courtyard. You will have to leave your roomcard at front desk when you go out. I guess you can't lose it that way! A small bathroom with (very interesting) hair dryer. Your appliances will not work unless you have adaptors. The air was off for the season but room was very comfortable and quiet. A lovely breakfast with choice of caffine =) and breads with spreadable cheese and jams. Included with hotel rate. I paid 12 Euros at hotel in Mestre for same breakfast post cruise. They held our luggage for us while we explored Venice till it was time to leave for the Marritima. You cannot buy the same cheap one way tickets on water bus from San Marco or Rialto. I believe it was 6 Euros for a one hour ticket each. We spent 13 euros for a 12 hour and rode the bus around Venice and out to Murano and the Lido. We considered it a cheap tour. Then we fetched our bags and headed back to Rialto to catch the bus to Piazzole Roma where we caught our shuttle to the ship. This hotel was reasonably priced for Venice, centrally located, clean and accomadating. We are here for the scenery, right! Enjoy your stay, we did!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FellowTraveler93
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with 3 people so we need more space than most. We were in room 104 and the room was small. The staff was very nice. As long as you understand that the room will be small this hotel is in a great location. The worst part of this room was the shower head was at my throat level and I am 5'8" so you had to lean way over to wash your hair. The breakfast was good each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Price”
Reviews.Author: Suzxz
Reviews.Content: Do follow the directions as posted in previous review. I found using the Best Western sign as my landmark most helpful. Look down the side streets for the sign and you're almost there. This is a great hotel, especially for the rate compared to other Venetian hotels. The hotel and my room were both very clean and pleasantly decorated in traditional Venetian decor. There was an elevator available and easy stair access. The bathroom was average sized for two star hotel in Europe. I found the desk staff to be very accommodating and helpful when I needed a referral to a store to pick up a new travel power adaptor. Also helpful when I needed to print a document for next portion of my trip. They do have free wifi for both your own laptop and will loan you a laptop if you just want to sign on in the lobby. Ask for the password at the front desk. When you open your browser, after your computer cycles through all of the wifi signals it can receive, when you open your browser you should be able to enter the password info. If this is not the case, type in 1.1.1.1/login.cgi and it will take you to log in area. They do have a two hour per password limit so keep this in mind should you think you will need to be on a conference call or otherwise on the internet for more than two hours consecutively. They never hesitated to give me additional chits w/ passwords as I requested the same. The breakfast was nothing fancy, but wonderful coffee and fresh orange juice, and enough breads to hold you over until your first big meal of the day. I opted to carry mine to my room so I could work while I ate my breakfast and they were very accommodating. There is a bit of noise from neighboring restaurant crowds until about midnight and then all was quiet. If you need a window view be sure to ask for it. I did not have one but that did not concern me as I only slept and worked in the room, staying outside as much as possible.

Reviews.Title: “3 things matter - location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: degreesnorth
Reviews.Content: Ok so this place is not the Danieli but unless you can afford to stay at one of the super swanky hotels in and around Venice then you are probably travalling on a budget. And why do you come to Venice? To lounge around your hotel all day or to sight see and soak up the atmosphere? The hotel is basic and clean and the room we stayed in was pretty small BUT is in a FANTASTIC location and for around 100 dollar/120 euro a night price you will waste a lot of time trying to find a better location. Less than a minute's walk from St Mark's square so you won't be spending hours ferrying yourself around on water buses. There is a fantastic bar, little more than a counter, in the next street where they serve amazing campari cocktails at a fraction of the price of the bars on the proper square. Breakfast was pretty basic and not great but you can grab coffee and pastries from the cafes round the corner if you are not satisfied. Down sides - on the firest night we let the porter direct us to a restaurant which was over priced and truly awful and ranks as the only bad meal I have ever had in Italy. Top tips - buy the most up to date Venice guide you can find before you arrive and pick restaurants and bars from that. Following that method we had 3 fantastic meals for the rest of our stay at not ridiculous prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fatface99
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review to rebut the previous review as I, along with the majority of the other people who stayed at the hotel, had a great visit. I went to Venice for my mum's birthday and travelled in a group of 4. We booked to 2 twin rooms. The first room was beautifully decorated and spacious. The second room was also spacious but was decorated fairly blandly. The beds were very comfortable but warning the rooms at the front of the hotel get the full on tones from the bells on the square which start from 6 in the morning. Safety was not an issue both in the hotel or in Venice. On the last day of our trip we were able to leave our luggage by the front door of the hotel and it was still safe and sound when we went back to collect it. The hotel is really close to San Marco Square and was very competitvely priced for its location. The continental breakfast was not great but I would say it compared to pretty much all the other hotels I have stayed at in Italy. The front desk staff were really helpful. One tip I would pass on is do not eat anywhere near San Marco Square as the prices are ridiculously high for very average food. The water bus connections were great and I would recommend buying a one or two day waterbus ticket from the airport as they definately saved us money compared to buying one off tickets. Also please use the directions given by a previous reviewer on this hotel as without her directions I would definately have had problems finding the correct alley to walk down.

Reviews.Title: “Location is IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: LAFRAGIA
Reviews.Content: We just arrived back from a 3day stay in Venice, Italy. This was our hotel of choice....and not a bad choice at all. It is definitely the reach of everything!!! We booked this hotel at the website choicehotel.com Lets see, we arrived at Venice airport at 8am. The next water bus to St. Marks was not until 8:45.(may I mention the most economical too!) It was 12euro pp one way. Honestly, once you get to the hotel, you can walk everywhere else. The water taxi's were advertised at 90 euros per trip. WOW!! On the bad side it took over one hour and twenty minutes to get to St. Marks on the waterbus because it is the last stop on the route and the water bus goes maybe 5km ...geesh..never the less, open your window or step on the back balcony and fill your camera with pictures. Since our check-in was not supposed to be until noon...whatâ€™s the rush? right? Once we arrived you get off and like the other reviewer said "follow the crowds" You will past plenty of vendors to comeback later and buys things..Speaking of the vendors..look around because alot of times you can get the same thing ALOT cheaper. When you are actually in St.Marks square you will be facing a blue clock and above the clock there is a bell tower with two statues, ( St Marks church should be on you right hand side too. ) make a right there. Then go down your second street on the left. Cross over one street and the hotel is maybe 5doors down. Hotel Diana is located across from the Hotel PANDA. I took the liberty to give such detailed directions because we originally planned to arrive at night. Everything closes about 7pm. There are street lights, but dim lights. If we would have arrived on the 945pm flight we wouldnâ€™t have made it to St.Marks until 11pm. It seems it would have been a ghost town. The street names are painted high up on the buildings. The hotel does not have a sign pointing out from it, only a sign screwed above the doors. So when you see the hotel Panda sign, you know it is right across from it. If you get to the Best Western sign, you have traveled too far. (check out the pictures I took for better navigation.) We arrived at the hotel at 1010am. Unfortunately check-in is not until noon and our room was not yet available. The receptionist was nice though. He said if we came back in 30minutes it would be ready. He allowed us to leave our baggage. We had a walking tour leaving from the Gardens at 11:00am. We took the tour and when we came back our baggage was unharmed and the room was ready. The hotel has a lift (which was very slow) it took twice the amount of time to make it to the room. (If you donâ€™t have baggage, just take the stairs) The lift can comfortably accommodate 2 adults and two pieces of luggage. We had room 302 which faces the alley...no problems there with me. The room is a bit small but enough space to get around. They had older decor in the room but a new plasma tv and two english speaking news stations. The bathroom was very spacious and well cleaned! The only thing about the bath accommodations was the towels smelled if they had been cleaned in vinegar rather than soap. The room has central heating and air (which the heat would not come on) But more than likely; like most smaller hotels, the front desk had the on/off switch to change from heat/cold mode. The temperature in Venice was quite comfortable so we didnt really need it except for on one incident when we had left a window open. The morning continental breakfast was satisfactory. After you sit down a woman brings your stuff out to you. There were coffee, cappuccino, tea, juice, biscotti, crackers, croissants, rolls, cheese, jellies, jams and yogurts. Mind you that I have notice while in Italy that they recycle rolls...(if you donâ€™t eat your bread out your basket then they will put it back in a bin to reserve to the next guest) So we did not partake in anything we didnâ€™t see come out a bag or wasnâ€™t sealed. My husband is a pretty hearty eater. They initially give you two croissants in your basket. So he had asked for another one. No probs...but when he asked for the third croissant...she seemed a little unwilling. Mind you we did not eat the rolls, didnâ€™t want the biscotti or crackers. He had tried a cookie they had in the basket, but it fell apart when you touched it (not sure what kind of cookies they were) and neither one of us wanted the yogurt. OF course she gave it to him, but after yelling something in Italian about croissants to the guy at the front desk...(lol) When it was time to head out , we had an early morning flight. The water bus starts as early as 340am. Since the rooms have no clocks, we had to arrange for a wake up call. I really canâ€™t say what got us up that morning, but it wasnâ€™t our wake up call. We woke up and felt we had slept much longer than we should have. We called to the front desk and there was no answer. We rushed to get dressed, feeling they may had forgotten our wake up call, then the phone rings...and the guy is saying its your wake up call...Hmmm... From the sound in his voice I felt we may have had woken him up. Never the less he said it was 300am and we were all rounded up and headed out by 325am. The water bus is maybe 5 minutes from the hotel. Since the ticket booths are closed, pay when you get on board. After he has picked up all the stops he will come around for your ticket or your money. If anything I wish they had for sure is an alarm clock. My husbands watch battery died earlier in the trip so we had to call down to ask for the time. All for all it was a great experience. I would stay here again and recommend to a friend. There are plenty of places to eat close by including what I have found the most affordable is a Mcdonalds. You can get an Extra value meal for 7.90 euros. Everything else is Italian.. Most pizzas will start at 8.90 euros and a 3course dinner is 15 euros. (pp prices) There are Gucci Stores and other high dollar stores. If I can recommend to take a grand canal tour and a walking tour to get the most out of your stay. The streets can be VERY confusing and I feel you could easily get lost.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Diana”
Reviews.Author: Shadow4808
Reviews.Content: Great location, within a minute of San Marco. Not difficult to find, however if you have much luggage, beware. A not well publicized fact is that porters are available at some vaporetto stations. If possible arrange trough your hotel. The cost is 30E for the first bag and 5E for each additional bag. Now back to the hotel, having found it it on a narrow street., the lobby is a counter with a helpful person behind it. There is a small, but very adequate elevator to get you to your room. The room is small, but livable, but now for the big surprise: THERE IS NOT ONE SHELF OR DRAWER IN YOUR ROOM. You can hang your clothes in the closet, but otherwise you will live out of your baggage. The breakfast is a standard European variety, croissants, jellies and a beverage. Free Internet is available at certain hours, but depending on who is at the reception you may be able to use it at other times. Overall the stay was a 6 on a scale 1 to 10. However, in center city Venice the choice of reasonably priced hotels is minimal. If one is is sure of good weather staying further from the center of the city might be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “The People Make the Difference”
Reviews.Author: Cyberworld Toronto
Reviews.Content: The property is steps away from San Marco Square, but that is not the reason necessarily that I liked the property. The people at the desk were genuinely nice, hospitable and genuine. These are characteristics that you rarely find in hotels anymore. If you want to stay in a place where you are truly appreciated, as a customer, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Diana - great!”
Reviews.Author: molliedaisy
Reviews.Content: I came to Venice with my sister for a birthday treat. We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The rooms were very clean and had everything you would need. Breakfast was continental but good - lovely coffee. All the hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Its location makes it an ideal place to stay. Lynda Nottingham

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location,Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: missming
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel after reading other peoples reviews and so pleased i did,it is 2 mins from the hustle and bustle of St Marks Sq,A small hotel with 3 floors,we arrived in our hotel after catching the public water taxi 12 euros each about 1hr 15 mins,not more than 1omins from airport terminal,follow the signs,so easy.we travelled on the 11th march 2008,64deg-armed with hat gloves boots scarves-it was t-shirt weather!check in was quick,was shown to our roam and very pleased with it,safe,mini bar and very clean and warm,(air-conditioned as well)breakfast was between 7-10am,continental style choice of tea,coffee,hot chocolate,warm croissant,yougert,cheese ,butter,biscuits,sweet biscuits,jams and toast,it did fill us up.Could nt hear any noise during the night.We stayed in Venice for 4 days.it is the best placed i have visited,its is so romantic,beautiful buildings-no 2 alike,no traffic,this is the only holiday i have taken 141 photos,gondala ride was the best 80 euros for the 2 of us,well worth it,you most definatley need a map to get around,Venice is a warren of narrow streets,alleys,squares,cafes,resturants and tourists,very clean indeed,even the loos public 1 euro and the cafes were mega clean,the only thing i would say is the eating places so very expensive you cant go to Venice on a budget if you are B+B,Iloved every minuite of Venice and would recommend this place and hotel to everyone

Reviews.Title: “Very Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: jvaidy
Reviews.Content: This was an average budget hotel, We were forced to book something as we wanted a hotel close to san marco square and were on a budget, the clerk at the front desk was rude and curt, though not unhelpful, the break fast in the morning was very basic. Our room which one of the biggest that the hotel had was small , The elevators were small and creaky. While I can say the location was extremly good, there were not too many positives about this hotel. They said they would provide free internet access, but it was only at a specific hour. On the whole venice is a very expensive place , be prepared to spend a lot to get any luxury in venice. Venice is a beautiful place , but don't plan too long a stay, as it is both prohibitively expensive and also can get to u after 2 or 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but some problems”
Reviews.Author: TravelmouseUK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good value for money and very central to St Marcos Piazza, tourist attractions, and vaporetto links. The room and bathroom were small but spotlessly clean. However, the alleyway is so noisy it was difficult to sleep until the early hours unless windows were fully closed. Two of the reception staff were unwelcoming and one particularly unhelpful towards the end of our stay when we were faced with a possible flight cancellation. We were also concerned about security as identities went unchecked when collecting our key from reception at the end of each day, although there is a safe in each room for valuables.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: PieroG
Reviews.Content: This is the second time that we stay at this hotel and have to say that both times we have been extremely pleased with it. It's about 100ft from St. Marks, has a ton of restaurants around it, in fact our room looked to an interior patio of a neighnoring restaurant. The rooms are very very quiet and the AC works perfectly. The included breakfast was very filling. I would reccomed this hotel to anybody that visits Venice and doesnt want to pay an arm and a leg for a room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nothing Special Room”
Reviews.Author: FreqTravGeorgia
Reviews.Content: After a glitch with a hotel we had previously reserved for Venice, we made a last minute reservation via Priceline for this hotel. My basis for choosing this one was finding the most reasonable price in the St. Mark's Square area. The price we got was about $200 per night. While this is vastly overpriced for the room itself, it is a function of the location. As previously mentioned in other reviews, this hotel is located on a side street just a quick one minute walk from St. Mark's Square. Since St. Mark's is a key tourist site in Venice, and, in many ways, the hub of nighttime activity in Venice, this is a fantastic location. To get to the hotel if you are arriving via train, take the water taxi (vaporetto) from right in front of the train station to the St. Mark's Square stop. (Piazza San Marco). Beware that there is a stop a bit before the right one with a similar name (Piazza San Marcoulo or similar) - this is not the right stop. Once off the vaporetto, follow the crowd to St. Mark's Square. The clock tower is located opposite the water (you can't miss it.) Take the first right under the clock tower and go down to the second? or third? "alley" on the left - Calle dei Spechieri. The hotel is a little bit down on the right-hand side. The front of the hotel is marked, but as the front is flush with other buildings and no sign juts out from it, it can be easy to miss if you are not paying attention. All in all, it's about a 5 or 6 minute walk from the vaporetto stop to the hotel. Not bad at all with wheelies or backpacks. The hotel offers no amenities (but what do you need them for when you are in Venice???). The lobby/breakfast area is somewhat small and spartan. Note to claustrophobics: the elevator is extremely small and slow. It fits two people comfortably - more than two is too much and not possible if there is also luggage. We had the room that was left when we booked - I think we got the last one. So not the best room in the hotel, I'm sure. I believe it was 105? At any rate, it had no view and was quite small. For the limited time we were in the room, this was not really an issue. Two twin beds pushed together, a small TV sitting on the desk. The bathroom was tiny - the toilet was so close to the bathroom counter, it almost felt like it was partly under it. While the room was tiny and looked old and very basic, the bed was comfortable and the room was clean - and we had air conditioning. So no complaints really on my part. The staff was friendly and welcoming. Baggage storage on checkout day was an unsecured alcove in lobby (but in full view of the desk attendant.) We left our bags for half the day and had no problems. Breakfast is included in the room rate. We did not partake of this, so I can't comment on it other than that it is offered. My key and only real issue with the hotel was noise. The walls are paper thin. During the night this was not an issue, however once people started getting up in the morning, it sounded as if they were in the room with us. There are plenty of restaurants, etc in the area. Overall - clean, comfortable bed, A/C, breakfast included, FANTASTIC LOCATION. Only negative is noise during day b/c of thin walls.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location good price”
Reviews.Author: ahowarth
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel through Thomson holidays - just hotel not flight - good value for a very central and comfortable base. Three of us had single rooms; two were big, one very small. All were clean and had all we needed. Breakfast was adequete and they even gave us it early on our last morning when we were leaving before the normal start time. Very helpful reception and would recommend to anyone wishing to stay close to St Marks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, a bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: fantaki1
Reviews.Content: Went to Venise for a week-end. It seems that all hotels are expensive there. This one was the most reasonable. The location is excellent, very close to Plazza San Marco. You can get anywehre in Venise walking or by the Vaporetto which stops nearby too. The hotel is decent; rooms are small but comfortable. Bathroom has been recently renovated. Nothing super fancy, but in Venise you can't get much better unless you pay a lot more.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Whitehulk
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was comfortable and clean. My girlfriend and I stayed there mid-March. Located on a side street approximately 1 minute walk from Marks Sq. The hotel was very clean and tidy and was better than I expected for a 2 star hotel. The staff were very friendly and made us feel welcome. The breakfast was basic but we're not big eaters in the morning so croissant, yoghurt, juice, coffee, biscuits and toast definitely more than filled a hole. The room was fairly spacious as hotel rooms go. The bathroom was immaculate and the beds were fine. The booking was made via their website and I encountered no problems whatsoever. I would have no problem recommending this hotel and would be more than willing to stay here again. If on a budget you cant go wrong. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: tadjr
Reviews.Content: Location and room availability were the most important choices for our stay here. We were running out of options since we booked fairly late, there were 4 of us traveling and we were having trouble finding 2 double rooms and we had a short time in Venice and didnt want to end up in Mestre. We lucked out and found a room for 4 people at the Comfort Hotel Diana. The location is the best part of this hotel. It is less than a 2 minute walk to San Marco and there are plenty of restaurants and shops within a 5 minute walk. Even the walk to the Rialto is about 5 minutes away. The room we had (306) was actually 2 rooms with a door separating the bedrooms located on the street side of the hotel. The entry room had the closet and the tv. The second room had the bath entrance. The hotel was clean and the bath was modern, the tv was a flat screen and the rest of the room appeared older and a bit worn, but still looked decent and comforting. There was a huge window in each room that opened to provide air. It was a bit noisy late at night and again in the morning when the delivery people started with their carts down the cobble streets, but you cant control if/when there will be people out having a night out. I do not know what the rooms in the back had in the way of noise since our room faced the street. If you have a problem with noise, then any room with an open window will be a problem, but for us it wasnt a big deal. The noise ended around midnight and the deliveries started off and on around 7am. We arrived around 9am and wanted to see if we could check in early if available. The front desk man looked at our confirmation sheet and pointed out 12noon checkin, come back then. He said we could leave our bags in the corner though. We came back at noon and were able to check in with no problems. All 3 of the front desk people we had dealings with were a little short, but not sure if this was a language/cultural issue or they were all just like this at the hotel. We just avoided them if possible. The breakfast was ok. Dont expect anything fancy, but we just wanted something to get us going and that was about all it was. Coffee, tea or chocolate, a croissant and roll, butter, jam, processed cheese and biscotti and juice. The breakfast hostess was quick and polite and we didnt have any issues with the breakfast. There was plenty of hot water in the shower and the beds were comfortable. Again, nothing fancy, but we werent expecting to be staying in a 5 star modern hotel in the middle of Venice for the price we got. Overall, I would say this is a typical small European hotel and the price/location couldnt be beat. I would stay here again if looking for a great location and good price being the main concerns.

Reviews.Title: “RIght in the Action!”
Reviews.Author: Hollylaine
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the middle of all the action, steps from St. Mark's square-great location! The hotel was clean, nothing extraordinary, wouldn't choose it for a romantic getaway or anything, but if your there to see the sights, it works. Kind of pricey, ay 160 Euros a night, but I guess that's a bargain for the location.

Reviews.Title: “It does what it said on the tin”
Reviews.Author: Peter11435
Reviews.Content: Maybe its because I left it late, but it took me hours of trawling through the internet in order to find some suitable accomodation for my wife and I. Most of the earlier reviews about this hotel had been only fair/middling so it was with a little bit of trepidation that I booked the Comfort Hotel in Venice. This anxiety was only heightened by the fact that we only finally arrived at the hotel at 2am to find a closed door and the lights off! Fortunately on ringing the doorbell we were warmly greeted in and shown to our room. Bearing in mind our proximity to to St Mark's Square, we were quite impressed by the size of it, and the fact that it also had a bath and yes the air conditioning worked on our visit. As others have previous stated the breakfast is minimal, but fair, and you are only seconds away from places where you can eat in the morning anyway. Overall, a good base for exploring a beautiful and unique city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & value, poor breakfast”
Reviews.Content: The key thing is the location. This hotel is under 2 minutes walk from St Mark's Square - the St Mark's corner of it. Rooms are clean and acceptable in size. Minibar drinks were good value. Our room had a view onto a tiny square below with a restaurant in it. Air con meant you did not have to leave window open if noise of diners annoyed you. They did not stay open late. Our room was made up with two beds but next morning it was no problem having them made up as a double. Breakfast was served by a very frosty girl who took her time taking your order despite there being only a couple of tables. Expect a hot drink, couple of rolls and an unidentified cold drink (ours was red). Cost was Euro 160 booked via the website of the hotel - excellent value for 2 people with a basic breakfast. Location allows you to get out and do some sightseeing before the crowds from off the island arrive. My inlaws stayed here in 2005 and 2006 but found that in July 2006 the staff on reception were much less friendly. Don't know if the 'Comfort' rebranding was recent, but the location is more imprtant than the person who hands you your keys.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Diana”
Reviews.Author: missgrits
Reviews.Content: Our room was too small for comfort. Some of the staff was not very friendly. Charged us for water for breakfast when we asked for more than one small bottle. We were supposed to split a small bottle for more than one person. The breadfast was included in the price of the room.. They questioned a heating pad one of the ladies used every night. No internet connection in the hotel. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hi My girlfriend and I stayed in the hotel Diana for two nights in March. It may be a basic hotel (2star) but our room was large enough with a lovely bathroom and lots of storage space. We had safe in the room which was useful. The breakfast was basic but lovely. The Italians make a good cup of coffee in the morning. The hotel is about 2 minutes from St Marks Square in a atomspheric little alley that is pure Venice. Staff where helpful and even did a hand drawn map for me when I was looking for a supermarket. I would use the hotel again.

HotelInfo.Name: Comfort Hotel Diana
HotelInfo.Address: Calle dei Specchieri 449, 30124 Venice, Italy
